website_summaries.verdict: The HP Envy Spectre XT (13-2050 nr) is a solid ultrabook with a stylish design, but its appeal is marred by a so-so clickpad and display.

customer_reviews.title: Could bring you back from the dark side !!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a macbook air 2013 owner, I've purchased this beauty for my uncle (on behalf of him, not with my money!!)... and when arrives...wow...it`s really beautiful , well crafted, light and the screen is quite bright and colors are full. Brand new after first configuration, it boots in no time, from power off to login screen...maybe 4 or 5 seconds !! My work sometimes involves some show off, so that`s why i will keep my Air... and the 12 hours battery with the Haswell new chip. I'm pretty sure in no time HP will release a haswell spectre...so, stay tuned... I think it will be difficult to find a prettier ultrabook out there ....
customer_reviews.author: Hernan H.

customer_reviews.title: Switched from MacBook Air to this and am thrilled
customer_reviews.text: The headline says it all for me. I simply never got comfortable with the MacBook Air, contrary to what others may think or say. I guess being a PC user for all these years, I just found doing things on the Mac to be too different and too hard. I am truly glad I moved back, and love using the HP and, surprisingly for an experienced W7 user, I kinda like version 8.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Kent Boyle

customer_reviews.title: defective.
customer_reviews.text: Item was received. However, it was defective. The computer would not hold a charge; it would shut down if it was not plugged in. I did call HP to discuss, and they suggested returning the computer. The computer was sent back and we had to pay $21.77 for fedex return of this defective product. The seller did not pay for shipping return on the defective product. This was disappointing. Also, the keyboard format was not US format, it was Canadian / French. I did not know this when purchasing the product, but the major concern was the defective battery.
customer_reviews.author: Ron I Citronowicz

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price...but noisy fan
customer_reviews.text: I received the laptop in perfect conditions and at the right time. It's what I expected, very portable, light, well constructed and finished. The keyboard is very smooth and the screen resolution is quite good, the RJ45 connector availability was the feature that made me choose the Spectre over the MacAir (and of course the price). However, the well known issue about the fan is real, it's noisy and you'll notice that from the begining. A good product for the price, best value for money in ultrabook category.
customer_reviews.author: ESang

customer_reviews.title: had to return it
customer_reviews.text: 1. The WiFi antenna has very short range. 2. Windows 8 without touchscreen is very problematic. With Windows 7 & a proper antenna, this would be very good. But now the YOGA is the same price range and way ahead of the pack.
customer_reviews.author: Juan C. Larach

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: i love my new laptop. i have been using it for a year. everything looks good so far. the wireless connection goes off easily. battery is durable. but trouble to release the heat. a little bit noisy. but still goof in general. super light!!
customer_reviews.author: xiaoyue

customer_reviews.title: HP ENVY 13-2150nr Spectre XT 13.3" Ultrabook (Silver)
customer_reviews.text: Internal battery error, this laptop should have never been presented on Amazon. The seller knew this laptop was internal battery was bad, but shipped anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: Hate it, and can't return it
customer_reviews.text: It is so hard to use. The caps keys don't work. The screen has terrible resolution. BUT because it was sold by some other middleman company, not Amazon--I was told if I try to return it I will have to pay a 20% restocking fee. Absolutely frustrated, and will never, ever buy another electronic item from Amazon!!! So sad to spent $890 and feel so taken!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A Mulik

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line
customer_reviews.text: This Ultrabook is one of the better price to feature options. It's zippy even with the i5 and is well made. Worthy of full consideration.
customer_reviews.author: DonnieJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent notebook!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for, small & slim & I just love it! Excellent price & service as well!
customer_reviews.author: Jill A. Skemer

customer_reviews.title: but the battery life isn't great. The power supply does not plug into the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough for me, but the battery life isn't great. The power supply does not plug into the computer very securely which makes it hard to charge. The wifi capabilities are not very strong either
customer_reviews.author: Adam Holmes

customer_reviews.title: This is really fast computer. However, the provider ...
customer_reviews.text: This is really fast computer. However, the provider, Coldwater20, sold this as a new computer and according to HP it is refurbished.
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: Good if your purchase doesn't have the hinge problem.
customer_reviews.text: Plagued by hinge problem. Just 8 months later the screen is falling off. I never mistreated it or anything like that.
customer_reviews.author: stuff guy

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: The laptop is awesome. Fast, Thin, Light. But there is just one problem. As stated the processor should be 2.6GHz core-i5. Actually, it is a 1.7GHz processor. However, it doesn't hurt much!
customer_reviews.author: Jinrong Chen

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast
customer_reviews.text: Small, fast, and powerful. 6 seconds from turning on to logon screen. SSD is smaller than I like but I knew that when I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and well manufactured
customer_reviews.text: This computer has a great ergonomic feel. It also feels very robust. Windows 8 however keeps it from unleashing the power that it is capable of.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Czecholinski

customer_reviews.title: So far so great
customer_reviews.text: Hoping this will be much lighter and more convenient for this up coming school year. I have bought from hp before and was not impressed so hopefully this one will not be a let down.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: lightweight powerful
customer_reviews.text: so leightweight. love the processor speed and long battery life.also small enough to fit in my purse. wonderful graphics and bright screen
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: lightweight, fast and sleek! windows 8 took a little time to get used to, but otherwise, it's a fantastic purchase!
customer_reviews.author: ALICIA HAMMOND

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: it is a great laptop, much cheaper than thamsong,. i dont like the win8 and changed to win7 with the help from hp, their after sale service is great!
customer_reviews.author: alexlichao

customer_reviews.title: Right choice
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wife who likes to have small and convenient laptop computer that she can carry around. It has very nice form factor with light weight. It is fast with flash drive which seems to be generous for her use.
customer_reviews.author: Hwan Y. Yoo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing prize and fast delivery. I received it in 2 days and It works very well. As a traveler I had to say it satisfied me when I was wandering in the US!
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: Could have a dedicated board
customer_reviews.text: This ultrabook is what i was looking for! Small, thin and fast, but could have a dedicated board althrough integrated
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Sampaio Rezende

customer_reviews.title: Great product but a few thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a lightweight, fast notebook for work - no gaming, no video streaming nor fancy multimídia app. And this HP delivers that well. The cockpit is really nice and the 100% based SSD storage is incredibly fast. However, 128GB is still pretty limited SSD capacity, it should really move up to 256GB at least. The other great disapointment is about Windows 8. During the first upgrade it disabled the shutdown button and now it only hibernates... Still, did not regreat it...
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Quality of hinges and its maximum opening angle are not good. rest is OK
customer_reviews.text: You know you have got only 128GB out of which few gigs are already reserved for system recovery. Its recommended to burn your recovery disks (or use some recovery program like Macrium Reflect) to help building an external recovery media. Keyboard is good, mouse if responsive, display is OK for daily use (not FHD). The real issue for me is the hinges opening angle. The maximum angle I can push the lid is not good enough. Check "full" specifications before you purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Harsha Vardhan U

customer_reviews.title: Very good Ultrabook
customer_reviews.text: Elegant design, good performance even with Core i5, smooth and sensitive touchpad. Finally very reasonable pricing. I prefer this one over MacBook Air 13 inch.
customer_reviews.author: Son V.

customer_reviews.title: Nice computer. Sub-par hard drive space
customer_reviews.text: This is a great computer overall. However, anyone considering buying this product should know that upon arrival you will only have 60gb of storage space available to you on the hard drive. The rest of the 128gb drive is filled up with windows and some of HP's software.
customer_reviews.author: ThomG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sleep/wake-up times
customer_reviews.text: Starts up and wakes up within seconds. Easy to get back to work after a break. Very sleek and light as well.
customer_reviews.author: Poulomi Pal

customer_reviews.title: Best PC ever
customer_reviews.text: Very slim sleet PC. Bought 1 and 4 weeks after bought another for my daughter in collage. She loves it as ITI is light to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Ogilvie

customer_reviews.title: Grounding issue
customer_reviews.text: I will limit this review to two things: Linux and the touchpad. Once I disabled UEFI, I installed Ubuntu 13.04 on the SpectreXT without problem and everything worked out of the box (bluetooth, wifi, webcam...). So that's a good thing. But the touchpad has a grounding issue: if I place a finger on it, unmoving, it jumps all over the place. Add another finger on the plastic body of the laptop and it stops. There must be some trick to fixing this because I don't really want to send it back now that everything is installed as I want. But it's basically unusable without your second hand laying on the base.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Price for an Ultrabook
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a really good Ultrabook! I use it when I travel and have been extremely happy with it's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Swindell

customer_reviews.title: Almost as good as my Mac
customer_reviews.text: I truly love this laptop! All the ports, very light weight/portable, Windows 8; it is a steal for the price! My only complaint is the trackpad. Switching from the seamless simplicity of a Mac's trackpad, this was amazingly cumbersome and has terrible responsiveness. If I didn't have a mouse, I honestly wouldn't use this computer because the trackpad is so terrible. C'mon HP! Its so simple, but something that is a deal-breaker for me. It ruins the entire experience. With a mouse, I find myself using my HP more than my MacBook though!! I love Windows 8
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Mac

customer_reviews.title: high speed and insufficient storage spaces
customer_reviews.text: This laptop has a quick run and startup speed. But the win 8 system and apps take up too much storage spaces. We only have 60 GB storage space. it is not enough to store our daily data and apps
customer_reviews.author: Duan Wenjun
